title: How to Grill a Blade Steak

parts.name: Cooking Blade Steak on the Grill

steps.headline: Marinate the steak in an acidic marinade for several hours.
steps.description: Mix a flavorful marinade that contains an acidic ingredient such as orange juice, vinegar, or mustard. Cover the meat completely in the marinade and put it in the refrigerator. Because blade steak is a tougher cut, it's important to refrigerate the meat in the marinade for at least 6 hours to tenderize it.

steps.headline: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium and oil the grate.
steps.description: Turn a gas grill on to medium or light a chimney full of charcoal briquettes. Once the coals are ashy, dump them in a single layer across the grill. Then use tongs to hold a paper towel dipped in oil. Rub it over the grate to prevent the steaks from sticking. Use vegetable, canola, or coconut oil.

steps.headline: Remove the steak from the marinade and pat it dry.
steps.description: When you're ready to grill the meat, remove it from the refrigerator. Lift the steak out of the marinade and set it on a cutting board or plate. Use paper towels to pat it completely dry. Discard the marinade once you've taken the meat out.

steps.headline: Grill the steak for 6 to 8 minutes.
steps.description: Arrange the steak on the grill and leave at least 1 in (2.5 cm) of space in between them if you're cooking multiple steaks. Cover the grill and cook the 1 in (2.5 cm) steak for 6 to 8 minutes. If the steaks are closer to 3/4 in (1.9 cm), cook them for 4 to 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Flip and grill the steak for another 6 to 8 minutes.
steps.description: Lift the lid off of the grill and use tongs to turn over the steak. Put the lid back on the grill and cook the steak for another 6 to 8 minutes. For 3/4 in (1.9 cm) steaks, grill them for 4 to 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove and rest the steak for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Once the steaks are as done as you like, transfer them to a serving platter or cutting board. Leave the steaks to rest so the juices redistribute within the meat. For a medium steak, remove it when an instant-thermometer reads 145 °F (63 °C). For a well-done steak, the temperature should read 160 °F (71 °C). Slice the steak or leave it whole. Serve the steak immediately and store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 to 4 days.

steps.headline: Blend ingredients to make a spicy orange marinade.
steps.description: Zest 2 oranges and squeeze the juice. Put the zest and 1 cup (240 ml) of orange juice into a blender along with ⁄3 cup (79 ml) of vegetable oil, 2 garlic cloves, 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of soy sauce, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of dried hot red pepper flakes, 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of apple cider vinegar, and 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of salt. Blend the mixture until it's smooth. Pour the marinade into an airtight container with your blade steak. Refrigerate it for at least a few hours or overnight.

steps.headline: Mix a classic Worcestershire marinade.
steps.description: Stir 2 teaspoons (10 g) of Dijon mustard into an airtight container with 10 tablespoons (150 ml) of Worcestershire sauce, 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of extra-virgin olive oil, and 2 sprigs of chopped fresh rosemary. Add the blade steaks to the marinade and refrigerate them for a few hours or overnight.

steps.headline: Mix ingredients for a ginger soy sauce marinade.
steps.description: Pour ⁄4 cup (59 ml) of soy sauce, ⁄4 cup (59 ml) of balsamic vinegar, and ⁄2 cup (120 ml) of vegetable oil into a container. Stir in 3 tablespoons (21 g) of honey, 4 cloves of minced garlic, 2 tablespoons (12 g) of minced ginger, and 3 thinly sliced scallions. Refrigerate your blade steaks in this marinade for 10 hours or overnight.

steps.headline: Combine the ingredients for a fajita-style marinade.
steps.description:
Whisk all of ingredients in an airtight container and then add the blade steaks. Refrigerate them in the fajita-style marinade for 1 to 12 hours. For the marinade, whisk:

⁄4 cup (59 ml) soy sauce
1 tablespoon (8 g) dried ground ancho chile or chili powder
2 teaspoons (4 g) ground cumin
1 tablespoon (6 g) dried oregano

⁄4 cup (59 ml) lime juice
2 tablespoons (25 g) sugar
4 cloves garlic
1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) cayenne pepper
2 tablespoons (2 g) chopped fresh cilantro leaves

⁄3 cup (79 ml) olive oil

steps.headline: Whisk the ingredients for a lemon oregano marinade.
steps.description: Whisk ⁄4 cup (59 ml) of lemon juice into a bowl with ⁄3 cup (79 ml) of olive oil. Continue to whisk in 1/4 cup (5 g) of chopped fresh oregano, 1 tablespoon (6 g) of grated lemon peel, 4 cloves of minced garlic, and 1 teaspoon (2 g) of ground pepper. Marinate the blade steaks in the mixture for 6 hours or overnight. Keep the meat refrigerated in an airtight container as it marinates.
